abstract: Royal Bank of Scotland, which is majority-owned by the government after a 2008 bailout, said Thursday it had set aside more money to pay bonuses to its investment banking staff after reducing its losses last year, The New York Times reports.
snippet: Royal Bank of Scotland, which is majority-owned by the government after a 2008 bailout, said Thursday it had set aside more money to pay bonuses to its investment banking staff after reducing its losses last year, The New York Times reports.
lead_paragraph: Royal Bank of Scotland, which is majority-owned by the government after a 2008 bailout, said Thursday it had set aside more money to pay bonuses to its investment banking staff after reducing its losses last year, The New York Times’s Julia Werdigier reports.

headline.main: R.B.S. Lifts 2009 Bonuses Despite Yearly Loss
